== Main rivals ==
== Main rivals ==
<!-- Listed alphabetically for a neutral point of view-->
<!-- Listed alphabetically for a neutral point of view-->
â
*[[Bolton Wanderers F.C.]] The teams are located close to each other and the match is considered a local derby.
+
*In an extensive census on FootballFanCensus.com in [[December 2003]], the surveyed fans placed [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.]] as a rival of Blackburn Rovers.<ref name="fancensus">{{cite web | url=http://www.footballfanscensus.com/issueresults/Club_Rivalries_Uncovered_Results.pdf | title=FootballFansCensus - Derbies | publisher=footballfanscensus.com | date=[[December 2003]] | accessdate=2008-02-11| format=PDF}}</ref> The teams are located close to each other and the match is considered a local derby.
â
*From a Town standpoint Blackburn has a long term rivalry with [[Burnley F.C.]] which dates back to the 19th century. The two clubs are eight miles apart and on some occasions violence has broken out.
+
*Blackburn has a long term rivalry with [[Burnley F.C.]] which dates back to the 19th century. The two clubs are eight miles apart and on some occasions violence has broken out.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.footballderbies.com/honours/index.php?id=56 | title=The East Lancashire Derby | publisher=footballderbies.com | accessdate=2008-02-11}}</ref> When the two teams play each other, it is known as the ''[[East Lancashire Derby]]''.<ref name=let700861>{{cite web |url=http://archive.lancashireeveningtelegraph.co.uk/2000/12/21/700861.html |title=Police combat April footy fools |accessdate=2008-02-10 |date=2000-12-21 |work=Lancashire Evening Telegraph |publisher=Newsquest Media Group}}
  +
</ref> In a 2008 report by [[Football pools|Littlewoods Football Pools]], the surveyed fans said that Blackburn against Burnley is the team's biggest rivalry, and the 15th biggest rivalry in the UK involving the 92 league clubs.<ref>{{cite web | title=Football Rivalries Report 2008 | url=http://www.footballpools.com/football-fever/rivalries-11to15.html | Publisher=[[Littlewoods]] | work=Footballpools.com | date=February 2008 | accessdate=2008-03-02}}</ref>
*Manchester City.{{cn|date=February 2008}}
*Manchester City.{{cn|date=February 2008}}
â
*[[Manchester United]] is a team located close by to Blackburn Rovers and so are considered a massive rival by the fans. The rivalry was extremely fierce in the nineties when Blackburn Rovers and Manchester United fought closely for the [[English Premier League|Premier League]] title.
+
*[[Manchester United]] is a team located close by to Blackburn Rovers and so are considered a rival by the fans.<ref name="fancensus"/> The rivalry was fiercest in the mid nineties when Blackburn Rovers and Manchester United fought closely for the [[English Premier League|Premier League]] title.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/03112007/58/premier-league-parker-real-rivalry.html | publisher=[[Eurosport]] | date=[[2007-11-03]] | accessdate=2008-02-11 | title=Premier League - Parker:}}</ref>
*The local rivalry between Blackburn and [[Preston North End F.C.]] goes back over one hundred years. In 1888 Preston refused to play a match against Blackburn due to their reception by the Blackburn fans.<ref>{{cite book | url=http://books.google.co.uk/books?id=fGI3Bgy54OcC&pg=PA245&dq=%22blackburn+rovers%22+%22preston%22+%22rivalry%22&sig=pmiXM65IMtdkbAKo2Y6WKjA4ReQ | title=Looking North: Northern England and the National Imagination | author=Russel, Dave | date=2004 | publisher=Manchester University Press | isbn=0719051789 | format=PDF | accessdate=2008-02-12}}</ref>
*The local rivalry between Blackburn and [[Preston North End F.C.]] goes back over one hundred years. In 1888 Preston refused to play a match against Blackburn due to their reception by the Blackburn fans.<ref>{{cite book | url=http://books.google.co.uk/books?id=fGI3Bgy54OcC&pg=PA245&dq=%22blackburn+rovers%22+%22preston%22+%22rivalry%22&sig=pmiXM65IMtdkbAKo2Y6WKjA4ReQ | title=Looking North: Northern England and the National Imagination | author=Russel, Dave | date=2004 | publisher=Manchester University Press | isbn=0719051789 | format=PDF | accessdate=2008-02-12}}</ref>
